TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 07-04-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James F. Perry, July 4, 1830. Assuring him that Texas affairs are clearing up.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 440

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, July 4, 1830. Assuring him that Texas affairs are clearing up.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Austin */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-04-1830">July 4. 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I embrace an opportunity to say to you that all the difficulties which appeared to be brewing when you were here have passed away, and everything is going on well, and emigration to my *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*will not be stoped— I have given you this information least what you see in the *location_mentioned*U. S. papers*/location_mentioned* should cause you to forget what I told you, which was to have faith in me, and to pay no attention to any thing you saw or heard that did not come from me— I know more about these matters than the *location_mentioned*news papers*/location_mentioned* and every thing has happend exactly as I told you it would, when you left here.*/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned*custom house at Galveston*/location_mentioned* is suspended by order of Govt. and the reason given is that the exemptions from duties in favor of the *person_mentioned*colonist */person_mentioned*of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*has rendered it unnecessary to establish any *location_mentioned*custom houses*/location_mentioned* here for the present— All goes on well, very well,— Take care tho and bring no Tobacco, except a little of choise quality to chew for the use of the *person_mentioned*colonists*/person_mentioned*, and try and get in by the *date_mentioned n="12-01-1830">1 of December*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*I have sent a copy of the above to *person_mentioned*price and Morgan*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Phia */location_mentioned*I have engaged the building of a *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*in this place for you to winter in and a *location_mentioned*store room*/location_mentioned* etc— bring all manner of peach seeds and a barrel of them—*person_mentioned*Sam Browne*/person_mentioned* is well and more and more pleased with the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*the more he sees—- remember me to the *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A */person_mentioned*[Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:]*person_mentioned* Mrs. Emily M. Perry */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned* Potosi Missouri*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
